post: Read “An Autopsy on the Man of the Shroud”, by Robert Bucklin, a forensic pathologist who have examined over 25,000 bodies. He went into great detail explaining everything that happened to the man on the shroud before, during and after death. After examination, he said there was no indication of anything that didn’t look right or out of place, blood flows, wounds, etc. It was actually like examining the real human body! Using your hypothesis, you don’t think Bucklin would know there’s something with the “picture”?.
